The services command is expecting a service LDAP filter not a bundle ID.  For example:

osgi> services (objectclass=org.osgi.service.packageadmin.PackageAdmin)
{org.osgi.service.packageadmin.PackageAdmin}={service.ranking=2147483647, service.pid=0.org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl, service.vendor=Eclipse.org, service.id=1}
  Registered by bundle: System Bundle [0]
  Bundles using service:
    System Bundle [0]

I just ran into this one too and thought it was a bug.

Since the Console "services" command is expecting an LDAP filter it would seem reasonable to catch the InvalidSyntaxException and log a meaningful message, such as:

  Invalid LDAP filter: <filter>

So when someone types:

  osgi> services 5

they'll see:

  Invalid LDAP filter: 5


This is particularly important since many of the Console commands take a bundle ID as a parameter.

Favor helpful messages over stack traces.
Patches are welcome to improve the console.  Although I'm reluctant to add any bulk at all to the console.  The console is something I would actually prefer to exist totally outside of the framework.
